attributes.action: Abolish the TV licence fee for people who have no interest in the BBC's output
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: The BBC provides excellent, impartial, and highly regarded output to not just the UK, but also the rest of the world. There are numerous people who do not view the output of the BBC, and it is unfair that they should have to support the people who do wish to view this content. I propose that, on digital TV, the BBC is made an encrypted channel that requires a subscription (given the licence fee, this would add about £10 a month to their existing subscription). For people without digital TV, an 'analogue tax' would be implemented as those people still have the ability to watch the BBC content. This tax would encourage take-up of digital services and help bring forward the switch over to digital TV.
